projectPurpose: To provide a convenient, terminal-based interface for browsing and searching security vulnerabilities (CVEs), primarily using data from the National Vulnerability Database (NVD).
mainFeatures: Terminal User Interface (TUI) for browsing CVEs
Search and list vulnerabilities from NVD
Easy installation via package managers (cargo, pacman, apk, Homebrew, Nixpkgs, NetBSD)
Options for force data update and offline mode

alternatives.name: National Vulnerability Database (NVD)
mainFeatures: Central repository of vulnerability management data
Enriched CVE data (CVSS scores, CPE, summaries, references)

alternatives.name: MITRE CVE
mainFeatures: Assigns CVE IDs to publicly disclosed vulnerabilities
Provides a standardized list of vulnerabilities

alternatives.name: cve-search
mainFeatures: Import CVE and CPE data into a local database (MongoDB)
Web interface for search and management

alternatives.name: OpenCVE
mainFeatures: Aggregates data from multiple CVE providers
Web interface with dashboards and filtering

alternatives.name: CVEdetails.com
mainFeatures: Includes advisories, exploits, and tools information
Tracks vulnerabilities in CISA KEV catalog

alternatives.name: CVE-Dash
mainFeatures: Search by vendor, product, date, and severity
View detailed vulnerability information (CVSS, attack vectors)

alternatives.name: Vulners.com
mainFeatures: Aggregates vulnerability data from various sources
Provides information on exploits and patches

alternatives.name: OSV.dev
mainFeatures: Aggregates data from multiple sources (including NVD, GitHub Advisories)
Provides vulnerability data in OSV format

marketPositioning: flawz is positioned as a lightweight, terminal-native tool for quick and convenient browsing of CVE data, primarily from NVD. Its focus on a TUI provides a distinct experience compared to web-based databases or more complex vulnerability management platforms. It appeals to users who prefer command-line workflows and need direct access to vulnerability information without the overhead of a full web application or local database setup required by some alternatives. Its ease of installation across various platforms is a key differentiator for users already accustomed to package managers.
